title: Self-Regulated Learning-Based Online Teaching Methods for Secondary Statistics and Data Science

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic statistical concepts and general pedagogical principles
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment exploring secondary statistics and data science pedagogy based on self-regulated learning in online asynchronous platforms, supplemented by practical sessions and feedback through face-to-face meetings

learning_goals: Learners understand statistics and data science pedagogy at the secondary education level and can effectively achieve learning objectives on online platforms using self-regulated learning strategies.

Within four weeks, learners design one statistics education material (PDF or PPT, 10+ pages), implement two visualization tools (heatmap, scatter plot, etc.) using Pythonâ€™s Matplotlib/Seaborn, and develop a data science activity module applying at least one data analysis framework (Pandas or TensorFlow) with real datasets (e.g., Kaggle open data). The module must score 70+ points on an instructor rubric (40% design completeness, 30% technical applicability, 30% analytical effectiveness).

Learners analyze their own learning experiences using personalization tools (progress tracking, customized recommendations) on online platforms, derive three or more optimization strategies, and write a 5-page report including concrete implementation plans (e.g., weekly learning templates, feedback system design) applicable to secondary classroom settings.

resources: Online Learning Platform (e.g., LMS or Custom Tool)
Statistics and Data Science Educational Materials (Case Studies, Multimedia Content)
Classroom and Technical Equipment for In-Person Workshops

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
